entities.name: daily lives
entities.description: Time zones play a crucial role in organizing daily activities and facilitating communication globally.

entities.name: telegraphs
entities.description: A system for transmitting messages over long distances using electrical signals.

entities.name: vast distances
entities.description: Extremely large areas spanning multiple time zones.

entities.name: local solar time
entities.description: Local solar time is a method of measuring time based on the position of the sun in the sky.

entities.name: Local Time Usage
entities.description: Using local time across long distances was inefficient, especially for trains and telegraphs.

entities.name: town or city
entities.description: A town or city is a human settlement that is larger than a village and smaller than a metropolis. In the context of time zones, each town or city would set its own time based on the local position of the sun before the standardization of time.

attributes.Size: Larger than a village, smaller than a metropolis

entities.name: 24 time zones
entities.description: A global division into twenty-four equal segments, each representing one hour of time difference.

entities.name: efficiency
entities.description: Efficiency refers to the effective use of resources to achieve desired outcomes with minimal waste.

entities.name: Technology
entities.description: Technology encompasses the tools, methods, and processes used to create, develop, and improve products and services.

entities.name: 20th century
entities.description: The 20th century spans from the year 1901 to 2000 and is marked by significant technological, social, and cultural advancements.

entities.name: Global Telecommunications Networks
entities.description: A network of telecommunications systems that connect people and organizations around the world.

entities.name: sun
entities.description: The sun is the star at the center of the Solar System, providing light and energy to Earth.

attributes.Role in Time Measurement: Used for local solar time before standardized time zones

entities.name: timekeeping
entities.description: The measurement and keeping of time.

entities.name: Standardized Timekeeping on a Regional Level
entities.description: The adoption of standard time marked the beginning of standardized timekeeping on a regional level.

entities.name: global trade
entities.description: Global trade refers to the exchange of goods and services between countries, facilitating economic growth and development.

attributes.Impact on Time Zones: The expansion of global trade contributed to the need for a standardized system of time zones.

entities.name: 19th century
entities.description: The 19th century spans from the year 1801 to 1900. It was a period marked by significant technological, industrial, and social changes.

entities.name: Trains and Telegraphs
entities.description: Technologies that played a significant role in highlighting the need for standardized timekeeping.

entities.name: BRITISH RAILWAY COMPANIES
entities.description: Companies that adopted a single standard time for their schedules in 1847, known as Railway Time

entities.name: Trains
entities.description: Trains are a mode of transportation that run on tracks and are used for both passenger and freight transport.

entities.name: world that is constantly connected and in motion
entities.description: A system of interconnected devices and communication channels that facilitate worldwide interaction and information exchange.

entities.name: WORLD WAR I
entities.description: A global conflict that occurred from 1914 to 1918.

entities.name: mid-19th century
entities.description: The mid-19th century refers to the period from approximately 1850 to 1870.

entities.name: coordination
entities.description: The process of enabling smoother interaction and synchronization among diverse systems or entities.

entities.name: Early 20th Century
entities.description: The early part of the 20th century.

entities.name: natural daylight
entities.description: Natural daylight is the light provided by the sun during the day.

entities.name: Real-Time Collaboration
entities.description: Real-time collaboration involves multiple individuals working together on a project or task simultaneously.
